data_migration_acceptance.description: Definition of done for replaying Airtable data into the custom Postgres schema once Frazer-stage fidelity is guaranteed.

definition_of_done: 100% of Airtable Prospects with stage=Relationship exist in Postgres `prospects` with matching owner and source
Automated comparison query shows < 0.5% variance between Airtable and Postgres record counts for this stage
criteria.validation: Run scripts/airtable_bridge.py --tables prospects followed by SELECT COUNT(*) checks in both databases

definition_of_done: All scheduled invites in Airtable Follow-Up Automations convert into Postgres reminders with due dates and owners
Stage transition history for Invited prospects is present in Postgres activity_log with timestamps within Â±5 minutes
For every Presentation Sent record, the corresponding Postgres task reflects the same Next Action and due date
Reminders generated at +24h/+72h/+120h exist in Postgres with status=pending unless Airtable marks them completed
criteria.validation: Run automated pytest `tests/data_migration/test_presentation_sent.py` (to be implemented) and verify green

definition_of_done: AI Coaching Insights tied to Follow-Up prospects appear in Postgres quick_notes with identical priority labels
No prospect spends >5 days in Follow-Up in Airtable without a matching reminder chain in Postgres
criteria.validation: Compare `SELECT lead_name, reminder_datetime FROM reminders WHERE stage='Follow-Up'` vs. Airtable export

definition_of_done: Graduated prospects sync to Postgres onboarding tables and are excluded from new-task generation
Historical activity_log entries remain immutable between Airtable and Postgres hashes
criteria.validation: Monthly checksum job compares SHA256 digests of activity logs
